entry.title: Updating CV or Candidate Data Submitted via Agency Portal (Before Candidate Applies)
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to clarify how this scenario should be handled in SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting.

We are working with external agencies that submit candidates via the Agency Portal. The agency submits a candidate to a job requisition, including candidate details and a CV. At this stage, the candidate has not applied themselves through the career site, and we are also not contacting the candidate directly yet.

If a recruiter later reviews the submission and identifies that some information is missing or that the CV needs to be updated, the recruiter asks the agency to obtain the updated information from the candidate.

However, in this situation, neither the recruiter nor the agency appears to be able to update or replace the CV (or other candidate data) within the same job requisition after the initial submission.

My questions are:

  • Is it technically possible for an agency to update or re-upload an updated CV for a candidate they have already submitted to a requisition?
  • If not, what is the recommended or standard process to manage such cases?
    • Should the agency withdraw and re-submit the candidate?
    • Should the recruiter manually update the candidate profile?
    • Or is there another best-practice approach recommended by SAP?

Thank you in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Re: Multi‚ÄëPayee Scenario ‚Äì REA2 Condition Type Not Determ...
entry.content:
Check the following:

1. Condition Type Group Configuration
Verify that REA2 is correctly assigned in the Condition Type Group for Accruals. Check if the Settlement Settings for your Condition Contract type allow accrual postings when Sold‚Äëto and Bill‚Äëto differ. Ensure the usage indicator for REA2 is active in the contract.

2. Table WCOCOF (Condition Contract Accrual Status)
Review entries for your contract in WCOCOF by looking at status fields (open, reversed, settled). Confirm whether the reversal flag is set prematurely. Compare with contracts where Sold‚Äëto = Bill‚Äëto to see differences.

3. Split Criteria in Billing
Check split criteria in billing document posting. If Sold‚Äëto and Bill‚Äëto are different, the system may split postings incorrectly. Validate partner functions and account determination settings. Ensure the billing document passes the right accrual information into WCOCOF.

4. Accounting Document Flow
Trace the FI document flow. Is the accrual posting created but not reversed? Or is reversal triggered but not updated in FI? Compare with VBO2 / settlement run logs to see if reversal logic is skipped.

5. Condition Contract Settings
Double‚Äëcheck the Settlement calendar (dates may trigger reversal incorrectly). Accrual indicator in contract header. Condition usage assignment at contract level.

entry.title: RGPD COMPLIANCE - Success Factors - Recruitment
entry.content:
No m√≥dulo SAP SuccessFactors Recruitment, proponho a introdu√ß√£o de uma check box obrigat√≥ria no momento de cria√ß√£o de conta pelo candidato, imediatamente antes do link para a Pol√≠tica de Privacidade da organiza√ß√£o (ver imagem).

O objetivo √© garantir que o candidato declara explicitamente ter lido e compreendido as condi√ß√µes de privacidade e tratamento de dados pessoais, refor√ßando o cumprimento do Regulamento Geral de Prote√ß√£o de Dados (RGPD).

Atualmente, o sistema apresenta o link para a Pol√≠tica de Privacidade, mas n√£o exige uma a√ß√£o afirmativa por parte do candidato. A inclus√£o desta check box obrigat√≥ria assegura:

  • Consentimento informado e inequ√≠voco
  • Maior transpar√™ncia no tratamento de dados
  • Conformidade com requisitos legais de prote√ß√£o de dados
  • Redu√ß√£o de riscos de auditoria e n√£o conformidade

Funcionalidade solicitada:
Adicionar, no ecr√£ de cria√ß√£o de conta do candidato, uma check box obrigat√≥ria com texto do g√©nero:

‚ÄúConfirmo que li e compreendi a Pol√≠tica de Privacidade e autorizo o tratamento dos meus dados pessoais para efeitos de recrutamento.‚Äù

A conta s√≥ dever√° ser criada ap√≥s a sele√ß√£o desta op√ß√£o.

In the SAP SuccessFactors Recruitment module, I propose the introduction of a mandatory check box during the candidate account creation process, placed immediately before the link to the organization‚Äôs Privacy Policy (see image above).

The purpose is to ensure that candidates explicitly acknowledge having read and understood the privacy terms and the processing of their personal data, thereby strengthening compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Currently, the system displays the Privacy Policy link but does not require an affirmative action from the candidate. Adding this mandatory check box would ensure:

  • Clear and informed consent
  • Increased transparency in data processing
  • Compliance with GDPR requirements
  • Reduced audit and non‚Äëcompliance risks

Requested functionality:
Add a mandatory check box on the candidate account creation screen with wording such as:

‚ÄúI confirm that I have read and understood the Privacy Policy and authorize the processing of my personal data for recruitment purposes.‚Äù

The account should only be created after this option is selected.

entry.title: Can we block position Update if done with the wrong Effective Date ?
entry.content:
we have identified a situation where employees are not correctly replicated because

Position is updated in Position Org Chart just after an employee has been rehired on these specific position.

If the position Effective Date = Rehire Date then Replication is blocked until the Rehire date is effective.

These is preventing 30d prior arrival creation in many third party systems.

After investigating these issue, it seems the only option available is to create an admin alert (Position Follow-Up Admin Alert.)to the employee updating the position (HR)  in order to tell him to correct the effective date of the position change to be greater than rehire date.

These means : 

HR rehire on Position X user A on Jan 20th 

HR updates with effective date Jan 20th the position 

Position updates is replicated in futur-records in job information.

The business rule to trigger the admin alert is only configured at the job information level, when correction have to occure in both :

- position 

- job information

to have a clean employee record.

it's rather complex setup to configure  admin alerts and there is high risk that HR doesn't go to Admin Alert and see the problem.

it would make more sense if we could execute a validation in Position Org Chart to compare position Start Date & incumbent Start Date. if these 2 dates are identical, we could have an error message, which blocks any wrong data to be entered on the system and forces correct date > rehire date to be entered.

but so far

entry.title: Re: Add batch number dialog box not automatically opens i...
entry.content:
Hi,

You wrote Automatic batch number determination is ON in CCO. That's the reason why the pop-up for batch number selection isn't coming up. Once you set it OFF you should get the pop-up each time you add a batch number article to the receipt.

 

The purpose of the automatic batch number determination feature is to speed up the sales process. When it's ON the items are added to the receipt without batch numbers. The (automatic) assignment of batch numbers comes later when the receipt is posted to B1, based on first in / first out principle.

 

Refer to the help https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_CHECKOUT/71570024ae3843f08a10d68054192d3d/d4584fc449d445429dd0e0106ee92b40.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST for more information.

 

Kind regards,

Gunther

SAP Support

entry.title: Custom pop-up to create Contract Account
entry.content:
BSP Component: ZCUSTOM_POPUPS

View: ZCUSTOM_POPUPS/VDecisionPopup 

Steps to implement:

1) Populate Buttons: In respective view, populate the buttons declared in DO_PREPARE_OUTPUT.

METHOD do_prepare_output.
*   Declarations
    DATA: ls_button  TYPE crmt_thtmlb_button.
*   Add buttons
    IF gt_result IS INITIAL.
      ls_button-text     = 'Yes'.
      ls_button-on_click = 'YES'.
      ls_button-enabled = abap_true.
      APPEND ls_button TO gt_result.
      CLEAR ls_button.
      ls_button-text     = 'No'.
      ls_button-on_click = 'NO'.
      ls_button-enabled = abap_true.
      APPEND ls_button TO gt_result.
      CLEAR ls_button.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

2) Expose Input selection of pop-up: The input selection of the pop-up view should be exposed as a value node at the component controller and in the runtime repository, for its exposure to outside world. It is further binded with respective context node of pop-up view.

3) Setup Radio button fields: Define the radio button property and its key-value pairs in the GET_P and GET_V methods of the OPTIONS attribute. Create the configuration and arrange all input fields as required.

  METHOD get_p_options.
    CASE iv_property.
      WHEN if_bsp_wd_model_setter_getter=>fp_fieldtype.
        rv_value = cl_bsp_dlc_view_descriptor=>field_type_radio.
      WHEN if_bsp_wd_model_setter_getter=>fp_radio_cols.
        rv_value = 2.
      WHEN if_bsp_wd_model_setter_getter=>fp_group.
        rv_value = 'R2'.
      WHEN if_bsp_wd_model_setter_getter=>fp_onclick.
        rv_value = 'DUMMY'.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

5) Initialize Pop-up context: Implement DO_INIT_CONTEXT to initialize empty input value nodes when the pop-up opens for the first time.

  METHOD do_init_context.
*   Declarations
    DATA: ls_struct     TYPE zinput_struct,
          lv_value_node TYPE REF TO cl_bsp_wd_value_node,
          lv_bo_coll    TYPE REF TO if_bol_bo_col.
*   Set input tray Empty on 1st load
    TRY.
        lv_bo_coll ?= typed_context->inputs->get_collection_wrapper( ).
        IF lv_bo_coll IS BOUND AND lv_bo_coll->size( ) = 1.
          lv_value_node ?= lv_bo_coll->get_current( ).
          lv_value_node->set_properties( is_attributes = ls_struct ).
        ENDIF.
      CATCH cx_root.
    ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

4) Event Handling: 

For the Yes and No buttons, create event handlers ON_Yes and ON_No.
Perform input validation in these handlers:

If validation succeeds, call the respective outbound plug defined in the main window.
If validation fails, populate the global DESCRIPTION field with an error message, which is displayed in the view HTML whose screenshot is provided at the beginning.

  METHOD eh_onyes.
*   Declarations
    DATA: ls_struct     TYPE zinput_struct,
          lr_comp_contr TYPE REF TO zl_zcustom__bspwdcomponen_impl,
          lr_window     TYPE REF TO cl_bsp_wd_window,
          lv_op         TYPE seocmpname.
    DATA: lr_gdc     TYPE REF TO if_crm_ui_data_context,
          lr_bo_prop TYPE REF TO cl_crm_bol_entity,
          lv_vkont   TYPE crmt_buag_id.
    TRY.
*       Validate Yes option
        DATA(lr_value) = typed_context->inputs->collection_wrapper->get_current( ).
        lr_value->get_properties( IMPORTING es_attributes = ls_struct ).
        IF ls_struct-options IS INITIAL.
          typed_context->inputs->description = 'Please select one option'.
          RETURN.
        ELSEIF ls_struct-options = '2' AND ( ls_struct-ausgrup_in IS INITIAL OR ls_struct-vktyp IS INITIAL OR ls_struct-kofiz_sd IS INITIAL ).
          typed_context->inputs->description = 'Please provide value in fields'.
          RETURN.
        ELSEIF ls_struct-options = '1'.
          IF ...
            RETURN.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
*       Call outbound back to source view
        lr_comp_contr ?= me->comp_controller.
        lv_op = lr_comp_contr->typed_context->inputs->event_name = htmlb_event_ex->event_server_name.
        lr_window ?= me->view_manager->get_window_controller( ).
        lr_window->call_outbound_plug( EXPORTING iv_outbound_plug = lv_op )." iv_data_collection = typed_context->inputs->collection_wrapper ).
      CATCH cx_root.
    ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD op_yes.
    fire_outbound_plug( EXPORTING iv_outbound_plug = cl_gs_ptc_bspwdcomponent_cn01=>co_event_yes ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD op_no.
    fire_outbound_plug( EXPORTING iv_outbound_plug = cl_gs_ptc_bspwdcomponent_cn01=>co_event_no ).
  ENDMETHOD.

Pop-up is triggered from an event where gr_confirm_popup is a type reference of the interface IF_BSP_WD_POPUP.
USAGECADECISION is the component usage that provides access to the exposed pop-up view.

METHOD eh_onconfirm.
.
.
    CLEAR gr_confirm_popup.
*     Raise popup
        TRY.
            lv_title = TEXT-001.
            lv_text = TEXT-002.
            REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '&1' IN lv_text WITH lv_vkont.
*           Call Custom Decision Pop up
            CALL METHOD comp_controller->window_manager->create_popup
              EXPORTING
                iv_interface_view_name = 'ZCUSTOM_POPUPS/MainWindow'      " Window Name
                iv_usage_name          = 'usagecadecision'                 " Component Usage Name
                iv_title               = lv_text                 " Popup Window Title
              RECEIVING
                rv_result              = gr_confirm_popup.                " Popup Access Interface
            gr_confirm_popup->set_on_close_event( iv_event_name = 'COPYCA_POPUP' iv_view = me ).
            gr_confirm_popup->open( ).
          CATCH cx_root.
            CLEAR gr_confirm_popup.
        ENDTRY.
      ENDIF.
.
.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD eh_oncopyca_popup.
* Declarations
  DATA: lr_window   TYPE REF TO cl_iuicmio__mainwindow2_impl,
        lr_cucomove TYPE REF TO zl_iuicmio__cucomove_impl,
        ls_input    TYPE zinput_struct.

  CHECK gr_confirm_popup IS BOUND.
* Get Response
  DATA(lv_response) = me->gr_confirm_popup->get_fired_outbound_plug( ).
* Get Popup Input
  TRY.
      me->gr_confirm_popup->get_context_node( 'INPUTS' )->get_collection_wrapper( )->get_current( )->get_properties( IMPORTING es_attributes = ls_input ).
      IF ls_input IS INITIAL.
        RETURN.
      ENDIF.
    CATCH cx_root.
      RETURN.
  ENDTRY.
  CASE lv_response.
    WHEN 'YES'.
      TRY.
*         Create copy of confirmed CA
          DATA(lv_vkont) = get_ca_confirmed( ).
          IF lv_vkont IS NOT INITIAL.
            DATA(lv_new_ca) = copy_ca( EXPORTING iv_vkont = lv_vkont is_input = ls_input ).
          ENDIF.
.
.
.
        CATCH cx_sy_ref_is_initial cx_root.
          RETURN.
      ENDTRY.
    WHEN 'NO'.
      IF cucomove IS BOUND.
*       Set Confirmed Account for Move-in only (AS-IS Super Confirm process)
        IF cucomove->set_account_for_move_in( ) = abap_true.
          lr_window ?= me->view_manager->get_window_controller( ).
          CALL METHOD lr_window->navigate_prem( iv_mi = abap_true ).
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    WHEN 'CANCEL'.
      "Do Nothing
  ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD copy_ca.
*   Constants
    CONSTANTS:
      BEGIN OF gc_mode,
        create TYPE bu_aktyp VALUE '01' ##NO_TEXT,
      END OF gc_mode .
*   Decalarations
    DATA: lr_prop    TYPE REF TO cl_crm_bol_entity,
          lv_partner TYPE bu_partner.
    DATA:lv_error    TYPE char1,
         lt_messages TYPE bus0msg1_t,
         lt_keys     TYPE busskeyval_t,
         lv_message  TYPE bapi_msg.
    DATA: lr_bp_cap            TYPE REF TO cl_crms4_iu_bl_cap,
          ls_create            TYPE crms4s_iu_cap_create,
          lr_message_container TYPE REF TO cl_crm_genil_global_mess_cont,
          ls_ref_ca            TYPE crms4s_iu_cap_bl,
          ls_data              TYPE crms4s_iu_cap_bl.
*   Field Symbols
    FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <ls_data> TYPE crms4s_iu_cap_bl.
*   Get core instance and message service
    DATA(lr_core) = cl_crm_bol_core=>get_instance( ).
    DATA(lr_global_messages) = lr_core->get_global_message_cont( ).
*--- GET SOURCE VALUES
    SELECT gpart INTO (lv_gpart) UP TO 1 ROWS FROM fkkvkp WHERE vkont = _vkont. ENDSELECT.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      ls_create-reference_gpart  = lv_gpart. 
      ls_create-reference_vkont	= iv_vkont.
    ENDIF.
*   Get confirmed partner
    lr_prop ?= typed_context->searchpartres->collection_wrapper->get_current( ).
    IF lr_prop IS BOUND.
      lr_prop->get_property_as_value( EXPORTING iv_attr_name = 'BP_NUMBER' IMPORTING ev_result = lv_partner ).
    ENDIF.
*   Read CA and copy data
    IF ls_create-reference_vkont IS NOT INITIAL AND ls_create-reference_gpart IS NOT INITIAL AND lv_partner IS NOT INITIAL..
      TRY.
          CREATE OBJECT lr_bp_cap
            EXPORTING
              iv_blobjectname = 'UtilsContrAcctPartner'.
          lr_bp_cap->if_crms4_iu_bl_object~initialize( ).
          ASSIGN ls_data TO <ls_data>.
          IF lr_bp_cap->if_crms4_iu_bl_access~read_attr( EXPORTING is_key = VALUE crms4s_iu_cap_key( vkont = ls_create-reference_vkont gpart = ls_create-reference_gpart )
                                                                    ir_message_container = lr_message_container
                                                         IMPORTING es_data = ls_ref_ca ).
            <ls_data>-data = CORRESPONDING #( ls_ref_ca-data EXCEPT exvko
                                                                  ernam
                                                                  erdat
                                                                  aenamp
                                                                  aedatp
                                                                  abwre
                                                                  ebvty
                                                                  abwra
                                                                  abvty
                                                                  abwma
                                                                  loevm
                                                                  adrnb
                                                                  adrre
                                                                  adrra
                                                                  adrma
                                                                  vkbez
                                                                  abwrh
                                                                  adrrh
                                                                  adrjdc
                                                                  cmgrp
                                                                  strat
                                                                  cpers
                                                                  ccard_id
                                                                  ccard_out
                                                                  mndid ).
*---        SAVE
            <ls_data>-gpart = lv_partner.
            IF <ls_data>-langu IS INITIAL.
              <ls_data>-langu = sy-langu.
            ENDIF.
            DATA(ls_contract_account)         = CORRESPONDING fkkvk_s_di( <ls_data> ).
            DATA(lt_contract_account_partner) = VALUE fkkvkp_s_di_t( ( VALUE #( BASE CORRESPONDING #( <ls_data> ) partner = <ls_data>-gpart ) ) ).
*--- clean  Payment Data
            LOOP AT lt_contract_account_partner ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_contract_account>).
              CLEAR:
                <ls_contract_account>-abwre,  "Alternative Payer
                <ls_contract_account>-abwra,  "Alternative Payee
                <ls_contract_account>-abwma,  "Alternative Dunning Recipient
                <ls_contract_account>-ebvty,  "Bank Details ID for Incoming Payments
                <ls_contract_account>-abvty,  "Bank Details ID for Outgoing Payments
                <ls_contract_account>-ezawe,  "Incoming Payment Method
                <ls_contract_account>-ezasp,  "Lock Reason for Incoming Payments
                <ls_contract_account>-azawe,  "Outgoing Payment Methods
                <ls_contract_account>-azasp,  "Lock Reason for Outgoing Payments
                <ls_contract_account>-eigbv.  "Own Bank Details
              <ls_contract_account>-ezawe = 'C'.
              IF is_input-options = '2'.
                <ls_contract_account>-ausgrup_in = is_input-ausgrup_in.
                <ls_contract_account>-kofiz_sd = is_input-kofiz_sd.
                <ls_data>-vktyp = is_input-vktyp.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.   
            CALL FUNCTION 'VKK_FICA_DI'
              EXPORTING
                i_aktyp       = gc_mode-create
                i_partner     = <ls_data>-gpart
                i_vktyp       = <ls_data>-vktyp
                i_applk       = <ls_data>-applk
                i_fkkvk_di    = ls_contract_account
                i_xcommit     = abap_false
                i_xcheck_only = ''
                i_xtest       = ''
              IMPORTING
                e_xerror      = lv_error
              TABLES
                t_fkkvkp_di   = lt_contract_account_partner
                t_message     = lt_messages
                t_keyvalue    = lt_keys.
            IF lv_error IS INITIAL AND lt_keys IS NOT INITIAL.
              rv_vkont = lt_keys[ tabnm = 'FKKVK' fldnm = 'VKONT' ]-valint.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        CATCH cx_root.
      ENDTRY.
    ENDIF.
*   Raise message
    LOOP AT lt_messages ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_message>).
      lv_message = <ls_message>-text.
      CALL METHOD lr_global_messages->add_message
        EXPORTING
          iv_msg_type       = <ls_message>-msgty
          iv_msg_id         = <ls_message>-arbgb
          iv_msg_number     = <ls_message>-txtnr
          iv_msg_v1         = <ls_message>-msgv1
          iv_msg_v2         = <ls_message>-msgv2
          iv_msg_v3         = <ls_message>-msgv3
          iv_msg_v4         = <ls_message>-msgv4
          iv_msg_text       = lv_message
          iv_show_only_once = abap_true.
    ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

Hope this article helps create Custom Pop-ups with various customized field options and buttons. Regards.

entry.title: Add Value Help to field ProductForEdit in Fiori App Manage Product Master (F1602)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am trying to add an additional value to the ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù field (ProductForEdit) in C_Product and then use it in the Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Product Master (F1602)‚Äù. But it is not displayed in the app. I suspect that the MD_C_PRODUCT_MAINTAIN_SRV service is doing something (such as hard-coding value helps in _mpc ‚Äì although I can't find them...) to override the annotations.

Here are all possible value helps for the ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù field (/ProductForEdit):



My metadata extension to C_Product:

@Metadata.layer: #CORE
annotate entity C_Product with
{
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [ { entity: { name: 'I_ProductStdVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        label: 'Products by Description' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'I_ProductByPlantVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdPlant',
                                        label: 'Products by Plant' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'I_ProductByDistributionChainVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdDistrChain',
                                        label: 'Products by Distribution Chain' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'I_ProdByEWMWarehouseVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdEwm',
                                        label: 'Products by EWM Warehouse' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'I_ProductByChangeMasterVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdChangeMaster',
                                        label: 'Products by Change Number' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'I_ProductByValuationVH', element: 'Product' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdValuation',
                                        label: 'Products by Valuation' },
                                      { entity: { name: 'ZI_ProductByMatchcodeVH', element: 'matnr' },
                                        qualifier: 'ProdMatch',
                                        label: 'Products by Matchcode' } ]
  ProductForEdit;
}

Here, I simply copied the annotation Consumption.valueHelpDefinition from C_Product and added my own value help. I can see that I am in the right place because when I remove some of the standard value helps, they are also removed from the app. However, my addition is not displayed.

When I create my own service based on c_product (and preview the app), I can see all value helps, including my own ‚Äì so the code/annotations are correct. It just doesn't work via the MD_C_PRODUCT_MAINTAIN_SRV service.

Does anyone have any idea how to solve this problem?

Many thanks,
Janik

entry.title: üá´üá∑ Joule Studio: Create Joule Skills and Agents Without Coding (Paris, France)
entry.content:
This is the all-new SAP CodeJam for Joule Studio, the new tool in SAP Build that lets you create extensions to Joule so users can use SAP's digital assistant in their custom workflows.

The CodeJam is intended to introduce you to the Joule Studio tool, so you can create your own:

  • Skills, which let you create predefined execution flows, triggered by a user's prompt inside the Joule chatbot
  • Agents, which lets you define complex scenarios that the agent can execute by iteratively reasoning and interacting with their environment to achieve a goal, using a selected LLM, and triggered by a user's prompt inside the Joule chatbot

The session will include a short, simple introduction to the SAP AI tools and some basic concepts needed for working with Joule Studio ‚Äì such as AI Core, document grounding, embeddings, and what after all is an LLM.

Currently, much of the session is based on the TechEd hands-on tutorials for DT160.

Prerequisites

  • Bring your own laptop with power adapter and have a supported Web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox installed on your laptop.
  • It can be helpful to bring a tablet or second laptop, if you have, to have the instructions on a separate screen.

Location and Date 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Wednesday, February 11, 2026 from 09:30 - 16:00 local time in Paris, France (CET). The language of the event and the content will be English.

Event Address: 1 Passerelle des Reflets, 92913 Paris La D√©fense CEDEX

  • The event is kindly being hosted by Syscons ‚Äì THANK YOU!
  • The instructors are SAP Developer Advocate @Dan_Wroblewski.

Please note that spaces are limited! We can only accommodate 30 attendees. If you want to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. About 2 weeks before the event, you will be asked to confirm your attendance and will receive further instructions.

entry.title: Beyond the Buzz: Making SAP Business AI Work for the Real World
entry.content:
We‚Äôve all seen the headlines. Artificial Intelligence is everywhere, promising to rewrite the rules of business. But for those of us in the trenches‚Äîmanaging supply chains, closing financial books, or overseeing complex migrations‚Äîthe question isn't "What can AI do?" but "What can AI do for my business data?"

In this post, I want to cut through the noise. We aren‚Äôt talking about generic chatbots; we‚Äôre talking about an intelligent backbone that understands the nuance of an enterprise.

Introduction: Why I Wrote This

While writing this blog, I am part of the SAP business transformation and architecture (BTA) team responsible for supporting our customers cloud transformation journey (both Private and Public cloud). The views expressed are based on my experience working with customers in various industries.

There is already a considerable amount of valuable information from my SAP colleagues, like this or this. My primary intent is to cut through technical jargon and educate you on SAP‚Äôs Business AI portfolio, share practical insights, and help you avoid the pitfalls of fragmented AI pilots and custom ‚Äúone-off‚Äù chatbot projects that do not scale.

 Who should read this?

Anyone (AI-Curious or AI-Skeptical) but specifically targeted to Leaders, Architects, or Business process owners who want to improve outcomes and support their business transformation goals. I will cover the WHAT, WHY, and HOW of SAP Business AI via below topics in this blog:

  1. Overview of SAP Business AI ‚Äì Architecture & Strategy
  2. Breaking Silos: Integration with 3rd Party (Model Context Protocol-MCP)
  3. How can you activate it?
  4. Setting the record straight: Myth Buster
  5. Impact of AI on your Enterprise Architecture
  6. Closing & Helpful Information

 

1. SAP Business AI ‚Äì Overview, Architecture & Strategy

AI isn‚Äôt magic ‚Äì It‚Äôs a tool that amplifies your current state. It either automates your bureaucracy or, by decentralizing power through shared data, scales your intelligence. A simple organizational AI equation:

  • Bureaucracy + AI = High-Speed Failure
  • Distributed Authority + AI = Scalable Intelligence

Pic-1 Organizational AI Equation

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

SAP Business AI Overview (‚ÄúWhat‚Äù):

When we talk about SAP Business AI, the most important word is "Business." Unlike generic AI that scours the open web, this is intelligence grounded in your reality, like your specific vendors, your unique material masters, and your organizational hierarchy.

Pic 2a: SAP Business AI

SAP Business AI is not a standalone product you "bolt on" to your system. It is a suite of capabilities embedded directly into the SAP applications you use every day‚ÄîS/4HANA, SuccessFactors, Ariba, and more. SAP Business AI follows a three-layered approach built on SAP's "Relevant, Reliable, and Responsible" principles. The architecture integrates AI capabilities across all SAP applications while maintaining enterprise-grade security, compliance, and governance standards.

The entry point or primary user interface here is Joule (e.g., Pic 2 b). Refer product link here. Think of Joule not as a search bar, but as a digital colleague. It doesn‚Äôt just point you to a report; it understands the intent behind your question. Because it‚Äôs embedded directly into the SAP stack, it already has the context that generic AI lacks.

Pic 2b: Joule - SAP AI Interface

The Architecture of Action:

SAP Business AI can be viewed as four simple layers (refer to pic-3): Joule, AI Foundation, Data, and Apps. This stack explains how users experience AI, how it is engineered, and how it stays connected to core processes.

The "secret sauce" is the SAP BTP AI Foundation. For the business leader, it‚Äôs the insurance policy that ensures your AI remains "Clean Core." But for the technically minded, this is SAP‚Äôs central hub for model management and orchestration.

Pic-3 The "Business" in Business AI: More Than a Chatbot

Four-layer explained:

A. Joule : Joule is the context-aware, proactive AI experience embedded into every major business function. It combines focused skills with Joule agents that collaborate across workflows, such as supply chain, HR, spend, and finance.

B. AI Foundation: The AI Foundation on SAP BTP is the operating system for AI. It provides access to SAP and partner models through strategic AI Partnerships, orchestration, vector stores, monitoring, and integration patterns (including MCP) for custom AI and AI agents. Through Joule Studio (which utilizes AI Foundation Services), we are now moving into the era of AI Agents.

 C. Data: The data layer provides SAP‚Äôs business data fabric and semantic models, enabling AI to understand business objects rather than raw tables. It keeps data governed and secure while making it usable for intelligent scenarios. Remember ‚Äì AI is as good as your data! To know more, refer to the SAP Business Data Cloud(BDC) product link here or blogs like here

D. Apps: At the bottom are the SAP applications running your end-to-end processes. Embedded AI is delivered directly within these apps, and standardized APIs enable agents to act on real transactions without the need for fragile custom integrations. Tens of thousands of SAP cloud customers already benefit from these embedded AI scenarios, all vetted through SAP‚Äôs AI ethics and compliance framework

Strategy: Pivot Fast, Run Lean, Grow Strong (‚ÄúWHY‚Äù)

SAP's vision is to fundamentally change how companies operate by creating a "system of intelligence" that not only reports on past events but also predicts future outcomes and automates optimal responses. The strategy positions SAP as the central intelligence hub of the enterprise, leveraging five decades of business process expertise to deliver AI that understands not only data but also business context.

Pic-4 SAP Business Suite - Intelligent Enterprise

Before we dive into the "how," we need to understand the "why." SAP‚Äôs strategy has crystallized into three strategic pillars. This isn't just marketing; it‚Äôs a roadmap for how AI is being embedded into your systems:

  • Pivot Fast: This is about Agility. In a world of trade disruptions and regulatory shifts, SAP uses AI-powered planning and analytics to help you simulate scenarios and change direction in real-time.
  • Run Lean: This is about Automation. By using "Agentic AI"‚ÄîAI that doesn't just talk but does‚ÄîSAP is automating routine tasks like invoice matching and exception handling to reduce TCO.
  • Grow Strong: This is about Scale. By embedding AI into a "Clean Core" Cloud ERP, businesses are scaling their operations without proportionally increasing their headcount or complexity.

At its core, SAP Business AI‚Äôs strategy is defined by three pillars:

  • Relevant: It understands the specific context of your business processes.
  • Reliable: It is grounded in your actual enterprise data.
  • Responsible: It is built on a foundation of security, privacy, and ethics.

 From the perspective of value generation, SAP AI Assistants represent a vision for the future. SAP Business AI is delivering real value today with a robust lineup of Joule Agents‚Äîready-to-use tools that are directly mapped to business roles and functions.

Pic-5 Business Value

Example Business Process (infused with AI)

Pic 6 Finance Business process(example) with AI infused

This (refer to Pic 6) is an example of a Finance business process where SAP Business AI does not replace existing processes; it quietly augments them end-to-end so the CFO‚Äôs team can focus on decisions instead of manual work. For example, during planning and forecasting, controllers can use natural‚Äëlanguage queries in Joule to ask questions like ‚ÄúWhy did SG&A spike last quarter?‚Äù and instantly receive explanations backed by system data. As transactions flow through record-to-report, embedded AI classifies documents, maps emission factors, and flags anomalies, making reconciliations and consolidations faster and more reliable. The result is a finance process that still follows familiar steps‚Äîplan, record, consolidate, analyze‚Äîbut each activity is infused with SAP Business AI to reduce effort, surface risks earlier, and provide proactive recommendations at every stage. More details here

 

2. Breaking Silos: The Model Context Protocol (MCP)

The biggest hurdle to AI adoption has always been the "walled garden." Your ERP data resides in SAP, but your context may reside in a third-party legacy system or a specialized engineering tool.

This is where the Model Context Protocol (MCP) (Refer to the link for more details or the SAP Blogs, like here) becomes a game-changer. I like to call it the "universal translator" for the AI era, which is supported OOTB in SAP Business AI, allowing Joule to securely reach out, fetch context, and use tools from non-SAP applications (like a 3rd party PLM, a specialized CAD tool, Finance tools, or a legacy CRM) without the need for manual data replication.

Why this is a Differentiator:

  • Contextual Awareness: Joule doesn't just "chat"; it understands the relationship between an SAP Purchase Order and a 3rd party logistics tracking number via an MCP server.
  • Reduced Complexity: No more brittle, custom point-to-point integrations. MCP provides a standardized way for AI agents to "browse" your external data safely.
  • Real-time Execution: It enables Agentic AI‚Äîmeaning the AI can trigger an action in a 3rd party system based on a command given in the SAP UI.

SAP Joule and Microsoft Copilot OOTB integration

A primary example (Refer Pic above) of this is SAP Joule and Microsoft Copilot integration (refer Discovery center link here)

 

3. From Concept to Live: The Activation Path ‚ÄúHOW‚Äù

One of the most persistent myths is that implementing AI takes years to complete. If you are already on a cloud-based "Clean Core" path (especially like RISE with SAP or GROW), the barriers to entry are remarkably low.

  • The Booster Approach: In the BTP Cockpit, Guided Boosters handle the heavy lifting‚Äîautomatically setting up subaccounts and service instances.
  • The Identity Bridge: By using SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS), your AI inherits your existing security permissions.
  • Connecting the Core: Standard communication arrangements link your SAP ERP data to the AI engine, bringing Joule directly to your Fiori launchpad.

Refer this for Joule setup (requires SAP For Me account) or SAP blogs like here for more details

Reference Cheat sheet for the activation steps:

To simplify your journey, I‚Äôve put together a reference visual guide based on the common hurdles I‚Äôve observed teams face during deployment. This is a comprehensive visual guide outlining the prerequisites, integration steps for both Private (RISE) and Public Cloud editions of SAP S/4HANA, commercial factors & key success criteria. This cheat sheet provides a quick overview of the journey from having common requirements, such as SAP BTP and AI units, to establishing trust, configuring OData services, and understanding the necessary licenses and support channels for a successful deployment.

Pro-Tip: One of the most critical success factors I've observed is early engagement with your SAP RISE Enterprise Architect (EA) or Account Executive (AE). They are your primary partners in simplifying the journey, ensuring your landscape is ready for activation, and helping you navigate the commercial entitlements required to get started.

Note: All RISE customers have a ‚ÄúFree‚Äù RISE EA assigned, so ask your AE for that (if not already). They are your primary transformation partners, and their success is measured based on your success.

Pic-7 Reference steps for SAP Business AI activation

 

4. Setting the record straight: Myth vs Reality

Although the list can be long, the table below (pic-8) captures some of the most common myths vs Reality

Pic-8 Myth vs Reality

 

5. The new blueprint: Impact of AI on Enterprise Architecture

Pic-9a The new EA Blueprint

To truly scale, your architecture must evolve. Force-fitting AI into old frames leads to "pilot fatigue." The impact of AI on your existing landscape is four-dimensional:

  1. Shift from Static to Adaptive Architecture: Traditional architectures are "static," relying on rigid code. We are transitioning to Adaptive Architecture, which learns continuously from real-time data and handles dynamic changes without requiring manual updates.
  2. AI Governance, Security, & Control: Governance is a prerequisite. SAP‚Äôs framework is built on Ethics, Security, and Compliance. AI agents, too, require Policy Checks in place just like for users.
  3. Seamless Enterprise Integration: AI acts as the ultimate "glue." Using protocols like MCP, AI agents securely interact with data across SAP and third-party environments, bridging the gap between structured ERP data and unstructured content, such as PDF datasheets.
  4. The Data & Knowledge Layer Becomes the Brain: Data is no longer just a record; it is the enterprise "brain." Knowledge Graphs provide explicit context, while the Vector Engine in SAP HANA Cloud allows AI to "remember" and "reason" based on semantic history.

Tip: Refer to SAP LeanIX here or talk to your RISE EA on what this means in your landscape and how to achieve this

Pic-9 Architecture as a Living Document

 

6. Closing & Helpful Information

SAP Business AI is fundamentally different due to its Business Context. A generic AI knows what a "purchase order" is in theory; SAP Business AI knows what your purchase order means for your cash flow right now. It also helps you replace the custom work and keep your SAP core clean.

With the advent of open standards like MCP and the ease of BTP-led activation, the "wait and see" period is over. We are no longer just transforming digitally; we are transforming intelligently.

Recommended Next Steps

Ready to see how this fits into your specific landscape?

  • Identify the low-hanging AI use cases like SuccessFactors, Ariba, or base Joule in S/4HANA by working with your RISE EA and get them activated in your non-prod environments.
  • Reach out: Start a conversation with your RISE Enterprise Architect (EA) or AE. They can help you identify business processes or bottlenecks with maximum ROI, from a short-term to a long-term perspective. They can also help you create a business value proposition tailored to your specific use case.
  • Explore the SAP Discovery Center for specific AI use cases.
  • Visit the SAP Trust Center to learn more about how we handle your data privacy.

 

Some Helpful information:

SAP Business AI is a game-changer for SAP Customers, and below are a few valuable pieces of information

  • Explore SAP Business AI here
  • SAP Business AI in RISE with SAP here
  • SAP AI Discovery Center here
  • SAP Trust Center (Security and Ethics) here
  • What is RISE with SAP? here
  • Get started with the AI - SAP Discovery Center mission here
  • Establish the Joule instance - SAP Discovery Center mission here

Contact your SAP RISE EA or Account Executives (AE) to learn more. To conclude, I would like to thank SAP's excellent Business AI Product development team for their sincerity and swift resolution of any deployment matters in current or past projects.

Comments or questions are welcome. Thanks for reading my blog. I hope this is worth your time!

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to limit to special files in RAG
entry.content:
Hi Jacky,

Short answer: yes, but it‚Äôs important to be clear about how it works.
AI Core does not ‚Äúread files live‚Äù at the moment a user asks a question. Instead, it relies on retrieval (RAG), where documents are indexed ahead of time and then selectively retrieved when a question comes in. So the real question is: can we control which documents are retrieved for a given question?

It can, and in practice, there are two common ways to do this:

Option A ‚Äî Separate document spaces per project
You treat each project (or auction) as its own ‚Äúdocument space.‚Äù
For example:
* Each project has its own SharePoint folder or site, and/or its own object-store folder or prefix.
* AI Core is configured to index only the documents associated with that project.
* When a user asks a question about Project A, the application points AI Core to Project A‚Äôs document index.
This approach is very easy to explain to business users and auditors:
‚ÄúAI only sees the documents that belong to this project.‚Äù

Option B ‚Äî One big repository, but with strict scoping (more scalable)
Here, all documents are indexed together, but each document (and each chunk) is associated with metadata such as:
* project ID
* vendor ID
* document type (requirements vs bid)
When a user asks a question, the application ensures that retrieval is scoped to the relevant project and vendor context‚Äîfor example by selecting the appropriate indexed document set or applying metadata-based filtering as part of the retrieval process.
As a result, even though the documents are indexed once, the AI only retrieves content that matches the current project context.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Order Output Time Stamp Time Zone in S4HANA...
entry.content:
Dear @CS11,

In Public Cloud UTC as the system/operating time zone is a hard design choice SAP uses UTC as the main operating system time zone and explicitly says it can‚Äôt be changed

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3514300

What that does and doesn‚Äôt mean for your PO outputs:

  • Yes, for administrative timestamps that come from system time for example Created On Date/Time the standard behavior is UTC and SAP treats this as designed behavior. SAP explicitly states this for billing documents and the same design principle is used in other areas timestamps are stored in system time zone = UTC to avoid inconsistencies across users/time zones

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3480071

  • No, it doesn‚Äôt mean everything everywhere must show UTC. SAP notes that some apps show user-specific time zone others show UTC and in some scenarios the time zone can be tied to an organizational object

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3395790

So if your PO form is printing a timestamp sourced from system time then out-of-the-box it will be UTC and there is no output-level configuration switch to globally render that timestamp, but customers are not stuck with UTC as the only option on the document. You have supported patterns to show local values, depending on what you actually need:

1. Store a local date/time yourself as a custom field at the business moment you care about and print that field. SAP even recommends this general approach in other objects when the standard Created On timestamp is UTC: create a custom field holding the local creation date/time and fill it via extensibility/Badi

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3503321

2. Convert in middleware / receiving side for integrations SAP explicitly recommends time zone translation at the receiving application, and mentions using extensibility/middleware for special needs

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Building Trust in Supplier Data: Insights from Sean Sollitto of Relish
entry.content:
Building Trust in Supplier Data: Insights from Sean Sollitto of Relish

In today‚Äôs volatile business environment, procurement leaders face unprecedented challenges‚Äîranging from supplier fraud to shifting tariffs and sanctions. In the latest episode of SAP‚Äôs Future of Procurement Podcast, Sean Sollitto, Co-Founder and VP of Sales at Relish, shared actionable strategies and forward-looking insights on how automation and AI are reshaping supplier risk management. üåç

Why Manual Validation Is a Risk You Can‚Äôt Afford

Traditional methods of verifying supplier details‚Äîsuch as manual checks for tax IDs or sanctions‚Äîare no longer enough. Sean cited a startling statistic: 84% of companies experience some form of fraud annually, with an average loss of $150,000 per incident. These aren‚Äôt hypothetical risks‚Äîthey‚Äôre real, costly, and growing.

The problem? Manual processes rely on hope, not certainty. Automation ensures consistency, accuracy, and speed‚Äîcritical factors for mitigating risk in today‚Äôs global supply chains.

Automation and AI: The New Risk Management Playbook

Relish‚Äôs Data Assure solution exemplifies this shift. By automating supplier validations‚Äîcovering tax IDs, addresses, sanctions checks, and banking details‚Äîcompanies can monitor risk continuously, not just at onboarding. Daily checks across 150 global sanctions lists and real-time bank account verification in over 50 countries help organizations stay ahead of fraud and compliance pitfalls.

Sean summed it up perfectly: ‚ÄúIf you can automate a process, you can guarantee it happens.‚Äù Without automation, risk management becomes reactive‚Äîand expensive. ü§ñ

Tariffs, Sanctions, and the Power of Real-Time Data

Economic ties shift overnight. Tariffs doubled in some regions this year, and 17,000+ entities now appear on U.S. sanctions lists. For procurement teams, this means constant vigilance. Sean and the SAP team stressed the importance of real-time data pipelines to update supplier profiles and category strategies dynamically.

Knowledge is power‚Äîbut only if it‚Äôs timely. Automated alerts and integrated workflows can trigger offboarding or risk reviews instantly, reducing reputational and financial exposure. üìä

Trust Through Triangulation

How do you trust the data? Sean‚Äôs answer: triangulation. Relish partners directly with curated data sources and banking networks, ensuring multiple points of verification. This approach not only validates supplier credentials but also builds confidence in ESG and diversity metrics‚Äîcritical for compliance in global markets. ‚úÖ

Beyond Suppliers: Expanding the Scope of Validation

Interestingly, these validation practices aren‚Äôt limited to suppliers. Sean revealed that similar checks are now being applied to employees, contractors, and even customers‚Äîespecially in industries where rebates or incentives involve financial transactions. This holistic approach ensures trust across all business relationships, not just procurement. üîç

The Future: AI Agents and Proactive Decision-Making

Looking ahead, Sean predicts a paradigm shift: AI agents embedded in procurement workflows. Instead of waiting for triggers, users will interact conversationally with systems‚Äîasking, for example, ‚ÄúHas Acme Corp been checked for sanctions recently?‚Äù and receiving actionable insights instantly.

Far from replacing humans, AI will augment decision-making, enabling procurement professionals to anticipate risk and optimize supply chains faster than ever before. üåü

Final Thoughts

Risk isn‚Äôt going away‚Äîbut how we manage it is evolving. Automation, AI, and trusted partnerships are redefining procurement from a reactive function to a proactive, strategic powerhouse. As Sean put it, those who learn to leverage these tools will become ‚Äúsuperhumans‚Äù in their organizations.

What‚Äôs your strategy for building trust in supplier data? Share your thoughts and join the conversation! üí¨

üçé  Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/episode-25-trusting-the-data-about-your-suppliers/id1764078646?i=1000744157727

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1EYn1znqijauUaA5hfN9Us

entry.title: I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.
entry.content:
I need a POV using Joule via BTP, but keeping data and execution on-prem or in NS2.  Here is my answer, wanted review of my pov.

POV

1. Architecture Approach

  • Hybrid Model:
    • Joule UI & orchestration via SAP BTP (public cloud).
    • Data & execution remain on-prem or NS2 using:
      • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed in NS2 or on-prem.
      • Secure connectors (SAP Cloud Connector, Private Link) for controlled interaction.
  • Inference Strategy:
    • Joule prompts processed in BTP but routed to local AI runtime for execution.
    • Sensitive data never leaves NS2/on-prem; only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP.

2. Key Benefits

  • Compliance & Sovereignty:
    • Meets FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Performance & Latency:
    • Local execution reduces dependency on public cloud for heavy workloads.
  • Innovation Access:
    • Still leverages Joule‚Äôs capabilities without compromising security.

3. Challenges

  • Integration Complexity:
    • Requires robust connectivity and governance between BTP and NS2/on-prem.
  • Feature Parity:
    • Some Joule features may depend on public cloud AI services; need fallback or custom models locally.
  • Cost & Maintenance:
    • Running AI Core locally adds infrastructure overhead.

4. Recommended Actions

  • Assess Use Cases:
    • Identify which Joule scenarios require sensitive data handling.
  • Deploy AI Core in NS2:
    • Use SAP AI Core/AI Foundation for local inference.
  • Implement Secure Connectivity:
    • SAP Cloud Connector + Private Link for controlled communication.
  • Governance Framework:
    • Define data classification, prompt filtering, and audit mechanisms.

Key Components

  1. Joule Interface
    Embedded in SAP applications (e.g., S/4HANA, SuccessFactors) for user interaction.

  2. SAP BTP (Public Cloud)
    Acts as the orchestration layer for Joule, handling prompt routing and metadata exchange.

  3. Secure Connectivity

    • SAP Cloud Connector and Private Link ensure encrypted, controlled communication between BTP and NS2/on-prem systems.

  4. On-Prem/NS2 AI Runtime

    • SAP AI Core/AI Foundation deployed locally for inference and processing.
    • Sensitive data never leaves the secure environment.

  5. ERP Systems (S/4HANA, ECC)
    Hosted in NS2/on-prem for transactional and operational data.

  6. Compliance & Governance Layer

    • Enforces FedRAMP, ITAR, and other regulatory standards.
    • Includes audit, logging, and prompt filtering.

Data Flow

  • User ‚Üí Joule ‚Üí BTP ‚Üí Secure Connector ‚Üí NS2 AI Core ‚Üí ERP Systems
  • Only metadata or anonymized context flows to BTP; all sensitive data and execution remain local.

Benefits

  • Regulatory Compliance: Meets strict security and sovereignty requirements.
  • Innovation Access: Leverages Joule without compromising sensitive data.
  • Performance: Local execution reduces latency for critical workloads.

entry.title: Reccommended C_SEC "SAP Security Administration" Practical (not Theoretical) certification material?
entry.content:
Hello, I am looking to take the  C_SEC "SAP Certified Associate - Security Administrator" Practical (not Theoretical, as now that version of the examination is retired) certification: 

https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-security-administrator

Does anyone have recommendations on practice materials relevant to the practical version, that are not listed below? (because I am already reviewing them):

  • All "Recommended steps to prepare for the exam" Learning Journeys/Courses on the webpage
  • All digital exercises in each Learning Journey attached (quizzes, step-by-step exercises)
  • All Live Sessions attached to each Learning Journey (under "Level up your skills" section)
  • And the following Hands-On practice systems: Hands-on Practice for Exploring the Authorization Concept for SAP Fiori on SAP S/4HANA (for textbook ADM945), Hands-on Practice for Exploring the Authorization Concept for SAP S/4HANA and SAP Business Suite (for textbook ADM940)

 The Live Sessions directly recommended for this certification are spread out across several months, and not all of them have recordings of previous sessions. I'm not sure what other Hands-On Practice systems or Live Sessions would be beneficial as there are only two Hands-On practice systems directly recommended for this. 

Thank you for any advice

entry.title: Item-level discounts and XML mapping in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Standard approach?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (2508), we are working with item-level discounts in SD using custom condition types (Z conditions). The pricing calculation works correctly and impacts the net value and accounting as expected.

However, when reviewing the e-invoice XML (DRC ‚Äì Colombia), we notice that:

  • Item-level discounts are not represented as Allowance/Charge at line level

  • The XML only reflects net amounts, and AllowanceTotalAmount is populated only when header-level discounts are used

My question to the community is:

  1. Is this the standard and expected behavior in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  2. Do most implementations model commercial discounts at header level if they need to be explicitly shown as Allowances in the XML?
  3.  Or is there any standard configuration (CBC / SD pricing) that allows item-level discounts to be exposed in the XML without custom developments?

I would really appreciate insights from consultants who have implemented SD and e-invoicing in Cloud Public across different countries.

Thank you in advance!
